documentType: arrest processing form and criminal history inquiry
summary: This document is a US Marshals Service arrest processing form and criminal history inquiry for Tova Noel, a Federal Bureau of Prisons corrections officer arrested on November 19, 2019, on charges of making false statements and conspiracy to make false statements. It includes personal details, employment information, and a criminal history check showing no prior convictions but several job applications.

events.title: Arrest of Tova Noel
events.description: Tova Noel was taken into federal custody via street arrest at 290 Broadway, FBI NY, on charges of making false statements and conspiracy to make false statements.

locations: 150 Park Row, New York, NY (BOP Employment Address)
Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St., Albany, New York 12210 (NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services)
keyFacts: Tova Noel, a Federal BOP corrections officer, was arrested on November 19, 2019, on federal charges of making false statements (18 USC 1001) and conspiracy to make false statements (18 USC 371).
The arrest was a street arrest (not from a facility) at 290 Broadway, FBI NY, and she was processed into MDC Brooklyn.
The criminal history inquiry showed no prior criminal history in New York State but listed several job applications, including with NYCPD, NYS DOCCS, and NYC city services.
An expired NCIC protection order record was flagged in the search, with warnings not to act on it without confirming status.
The document is a standard US Marshals Service arrest processing form (USM-312) combined with a criminal history repository inquiry from the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services.
